sections.faq:
How do annual plans work?
Sunday’s Tick Protection Plan is a comprehensive solution for tick control and reduction. One simple shipment contains a year’s worth of products to repel and control ticks for immediate relief. You’ll also get a personalized checklist with optimal application timing and key prevention actions to effectively reduce tick activity based on your region. When combined, this holistic approach can effectively reduce tick presence in your yard.
How should I apply my products?
Follow your custom My Plan Checklist (located on your account page) for Nix Ticks application dates, product instructions, and seasonal pest prevention actions.
For best results, spray in an up-and-down motion to cover your protected lawn area, trees, mulch, and bushes until all foliage is just fully wet, but not soaked.
How do I use it alongside a Sunday lawn plan?
Ideally, apply all lawn products before pest control products and allow for drying time in between applications. Always allow pest control to dry for a few hours before doing anything else to the lawn to avoid interfering with the product’s ability to repel properly.
How long will it last?
Our Tick Protection Plan offers you a full year of tick control and protection - meaning you’ll be covered for peak tick activity from early spring to late fall.
Nix Ticks applications will be effective for up to 2-4 weeks depending on your climate (effective longer in dry climates).
What products are in my plan?
Nix Ticks is a 25(b) minimum risk pesticide made from cedarwood oil (17%) to repel and kill ticks, fleas, and mosquitoes on contact. 1 bottle covers about 5,000 sq. ft.
What safety precautions should I follow?
Do not apply on flowering plants or near areas where bees and other pollinators are active.
What states are restricted?
DC, ID, IN, MD, ME, MS, MT
